name: ACM certificates have transparency logging disabled.txt - Introduction
description: This section explains that some of the SSL/TLS certificates managed by AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) have their transparency logging disabled. This means that these certificates are not being publicly logged and audited, which could raise security concerns. The issue seems to be more prevalent with certificates that have been imported into ACM from external sources.

name: ACM certificates have transparency logging disabled.txt - Certificates with transparency logging disabled
description: This section discusses certificates issued by AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) that have transparency logging disabled. By default, ACM sends issued certificates for public logging, but some certificates are imported from external sources and may have transparency logging disabled. The section provides examples of certificate IDs and links to crt.sh, a website that tracks certificate transparency logs.
use_cases: Identifying certificates with transparency logging disabled

name: ACM certificates have transparency logging disabled.txt - Certificates with transparency logging enabled
description: This section provides information about identifying whether a specific SSL/TLS certificate has transparency logging enabled or not. Transparency logging is a security feature that helps detect and prevent the issuance of misissued certificates by publicly logging all issued certificates. The section includes a specific certificate ID and a link to a website (crt.sh) where you can check if that certificate has transparency logging enabled. It also mentions that some certificates might be issued in different AWS regions like us-east-1 (for CloudFront) or ap-south-1 (default), and that certain certificates issued by payment networks like Visa and MasterCard have been excluded from this documentation.
use_cases: Verifying if a specific SSL/TLS certificate has transparency logging enabled
Checking the AWS region where a certificate was issued
Identifying certificates issued by payment networks like Visa and MasterCard

name: ACM certificates have transparency logging disabled.txt - How to understand if a cert has transparency logs enabled
description: This section explains how to verify if a given ACM (AWS Certificate Manager) certificate has transparency logging enabled. Transparency logging is a security feature that logs all issued certificates to public logs, allowing anyone to audit them. The steps involve finding the certificate's serial number, searching for it on crt.sh (a public certificate transparency log), and checking if the certificate has a 'CT Precertificate SCT' section, which indicates transparency logging is enabled.
use_cases: Verifying if a specific ACM certificate has transparency logging enabled
Auditing ACM certificates for security and compliance purposes
Troubleshooting issues related to certificate transparency logging
capabilities: Identifying 'CT Precertificate SCT' section in certificate details
Auditing certificates for security and compliance
